page.title: 17Walking the dog.
page.content: Most{Saturday mornings}I walk the dog with my friends and their dogs. We leave the road where we live at about half-past eight and walk down the busy Headley Road. We walk through the village square with the dogs on a lead and then into the{cool quiet woods. }We walk down the hill where we let the dogs off their leads. We walk up hills and down hills, along rough flat ground. After about thirty minutes we come to a{big open space}covered with bracken and a path going through the middle. We call that The Plain. After a while we start to walk back to the busy road and the village of{Grayshott. When we're back home the dogs are glad of a{drink}and a{rest.
